snippet: The International Organization for Migration said nearly 5,000 have died in journeys for a better life, a majority in the Mediterranean.
abstract: International Organization for Migration says that more than 5,000 migrants were killed while fleeing their home countries in 2014, more than double the number in 2013; much of increase reflects surge in drownings of migrants crossing Mediterranean from North Africa toward Europe, often in overloaded vessels run by smugglers.
lead_paragraph: The International Organization for Migration said nearly 5,000 have died in journeys for a better life, a majority in the Mediterranean.

headline.main: Number of Migrants Killed While Fleeing Home Countries Soars
headline.print_headline: Number of Migrants Killed While Fleeing Soars
